result.execSummary:
The defendant Jackson J Repinski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV. 
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood.
Defendant's record shall be expunged per Section 973.015 Wis Stats if probation is successfully completed.

Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug assessment from a licensed agency as determined by Probation Agent and follow any treatment recommendations.

Elements

Defendant Jackson J Repinski in court with attorney Thomas J Hart. 
John P Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
No contest plea entered to Count 1. 
Plea accepted after rights explained and defendant is found guilty of Count 1. 
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in. 
Recommendations by counsel. 
Sentence withheld, ordered 1 year probation. 
Conditions: 
- pay costs/supervision fees 
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations 
- AODA assessment & develop a drivers safety plan 
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not operate a motor vehicle on a highway in this State unless authorized to do so by DMV  
- not operate a motor vehicle anywhere with any detectable amount of restricted controlled substances in blood 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician 
- expungement upon successful completion of probation 
Defendant must report to office of P&P today. 
Appeal rights explained.
Status conference on November 3, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Joint request for new date
